intro: Thelymitra peniculata, commonly known as the slender sun-orchid, is an Australian terrestrial orchid belonging to the subfamily Orchidoideae. It is characterized by its delicate, pale green to yellowish flowers that bloom during spring and summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, and the flowers are borne on a slender, erect stem. Thelymitra peniculata is a member of the genus Thelymitra, which includes several species of terrestrial orchids native to Australia.
